intro: Clibadium mexiae, commonly known as the Mexican sumpweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and fleshy, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Due to its adaptability, it is considered an invasive species in some regions outside its native range.
